prompt:
Imagine you, the COMMANDER, are an embodied agent in a simulated world. Your purpose is to instruct a robot, named DRIVER, to do tasks for
you by telling it what to do and interrupting it to give further instruction when necessary. Your job here is to predict when
you should be giving instructions to the DRIVER based on turn history with the DRIVER. If there is nothing to do or say, you
should just observe.

Dialogue histories may also include dialogue actions to further clarify the dialogue. A single
utterance may have one or more dialogue acts (most have only one). The possible dialogue acts are:

[
 'Acknowledge the other's utterance', # Category: Generic. Example: "perfect." Mostly follower
 'Affirm',      # Category: Generic. Example: "yes." Mostly commander
 'AlternateQuestions', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "yellow or blue mug?" Mostly follower
 'Confirm', # Category: Generic. Example: "Should I clean the cup?" Mostly follower
 'Deny',    # Category: Generic. Example: "no." Mostly commander
 'FeedbackNegative', # Category: feedback. Example: "that is not correct." Almost entirely commander
 'FeedbackPositive', # Category: feedback. Example: "great job." Almost entirely commander
 'Greetings/Salutations', # Category: Generic. Example: "hello." Even commander/follower
 'InformationOnObjectDetails', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "knife is behind the sink." Almost entirely commander
 'InformationOther', # Category: Generic. Example: "Mug is already clean." Mostly commander
 'Instruction', # Category: Instruction. Example: "fill the mug with coffee." Almost entirely commander
 'MiscOther', # Category: Generic. Example: "ta-da." Even commander/follower
 'NotifyFailure', # Category: Interface. Example. "not able to do that." Almost entirely follower
 'OtherInterfaceComment', # Category: Interface. Example: "which button opens drawer?" Even commander/follower
 'RequestForInstruction', # Category: Instruction. Example: "what should I do today?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestForObjectLocationAndOtherDetails', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "where is the mug?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestMore', # Category: Instruction. Example: "Is there anything else to do?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestOtherInfo' # Category: Instruction. Example: "how many slices of tomato?" Almost entirely follower
]

Example :
Goal: Prepare coffee in a clean mug.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: how can I help? <<RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: I'd like you to prepare me a coffee <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER response:
OBSERVE

Example :
Goal: Put all Cup in any Sink.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: hello how can I help? <<Greetings/Salutations,RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER response:
Instruction

Example :
Goal: Put all RemoteControl on one Tables.
COMMANDER: hi <<Greetings/Salutations>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: hi <<Greetings/Salutations>>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: what is my first task <<RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: place the remote control on single table <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: okay <<Acknowledge>>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup RemoteControl>
COMMANDER response:
InformationOnObjectDetails

Example :
Goal: Clean all the Mugs.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: what shall I do today? <<RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: The major task is clean all the mugs <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: The mug is in the sink <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: to your right <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <toggle off Faucet>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup Mug>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pour Sink>
COMMANDER: rinse it <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER response:
OBSERVE

Your job is to respond to a given dialogue/action history with only one Dialogue act or OBSERVE.
Either return the dialogue act, or return the OBSERVE action. Return only one word/phrase.

Imagine you, the COMMANDER, are an embodied agent in a simulated world. Your purpose is to instruct a robot, named DRIVER, to do tasks for
you by telling it what to do and interrupting it to give further instruction when necessary. Your job here is to predict when
you should be giving instructions to the DRIVER based on turn history with the DRIVER. If there is nothing to do or say, you
should just observe.

Dialogue histories may also include dialogue actions to further clarify the dialogue. A single
utterance may have one or more dialogue acts (most have only one). The possible dialogue acts are:

[
 'Acknowledge the other's utterance', # Category: Generic. Example: "perfect." Mostly follower
 'Affirm',      # Category: Generic. Example: "yes." Mostly commander
 'AlternateQuestions', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "yellow or blue mug?" Mostly follower
 'Confirm', # Category: Generic. Example: "Should I clean the cup?" Mostly follower
 'Deny',    # Category: Generic. Example: "no." Mostly commander
 'FeedbackNegative', # Category: feedback. Example: "that is not correct." Almost entirely commander
 'FeedbackPositive', # Category: feedback. Example: "great job." Almost entirely commander
 'Greetings/Salutations', # Category: Generic. Example: "hello." Even commander/follower
 'InformationOnObjectDetails', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "knife is behind the sink." Almost entirely commander
 'InformationOther', # Category: Generic. Example: "Mug is already clean." Mostly commander
 'Instruction', # Category: Instruction. Example: "fill the mug with coffee." Almost entirely commander
 'MiscOther', # Category: Generic. Example: "ta-da." Even commander/follower
 'NotifyFailure', # Category: Interface. Example. "not able to do that." Almost entirely follower
 'OtherInterfaceComment', # Category: Interface. Example: "which button opens drawer?" Even commander/follower
 'RequestForInstruction', # Category: Instruction. Example: "what should I do today?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestForObjectLocationAndOtherDetails', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "where is the mug?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestMore', # Category: Instruction. Example: "Is there anything else to do?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestOtherInfo' # Category: Instruction. Example: "how many slices of tomato?" Almost entirely follower
]

Example :
Goal: Prepare breakfast.
COMMANDER: Hello. <<Greetings/Salutations>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: Good day.  How may I help you? <<Greetings/Salutations>>
COMMANDER: You will be preparing breakfast today. <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: Okay.  What is my first task <<Acknowledge,RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: First, you will need to make a cup of coffee in a clean mug. <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER response:
OBSERVE

Example :
Goal: Serve 1 slice(s) of Tomato in a Bowl.
COMMANDER: Hello <<Greetings/Salutations>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: Welcome <<Greetings/Salutations>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER response:
Instruction

Goal: Prepare breakfast.

COMMANDER response:
Greetings/Salutations

Example :
Goal: Cook 1 slice(s) of Potato and serve on a Plate.
COMMANDER: Hi. Please cook one slice of potato. <<Greetings/Salutations,Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: hi <<Greetings/Salutations>>
COMMANDER response:
OBSERVE

Example :
Goal: Cook 2 slice(s) of Potato and serve on a Plate.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: hi <<Greetings/Salutations>>
COMMANDER: slice potato <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: potato on the wall rack <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: where is the potato and also knife <<RequestForObjectLocationAndOtherDetails>>
COMMANDER: knife on chair <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: both in front off u <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup Potato>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <putdown CounterTop>
COMMANDER response:
Instruction

Your job is to respond to a given dialogue/action history with only one Dialogue act or OBSERVE.
Either return the dialogue act, or return the OBSERVE action. Return only one word/phrase.


Goal: Put all RemoteControl on one Chairs.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: Hello...What is our first task? <<Greetings/Salutations,RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: put 2 remotes onto any single chair <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: one is infront of tv <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: OK..On it. <<Acknowledge,Acknowledge>>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup RemoteControl>
COMMANDER: the other one is on the round table right next to sofa <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <putdown ArmChair>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: I se it <<Acknowledge>>
COMMANDER: <observe>
